Job Title: Transportation & Logistics Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The position of Transportation & Logistics Manager will be Remote!

Summary

The Transportation & Logistics Manager is responsible for the tactical execution of process, compliance and management of Rexel USA’s national transportation and logistics support service network. Collaborates with the Regions, Business Units, and other Functional groups to drive rigid and scalable nationwide processes that are sufficiently flexible to meet the unique needs of each business geography while ensuring regulatory compliance and alignment of service partners with the strategic goals of the Company. Will also lead special projects as required to optimize transportations services, logistics support, driver safety, and business workflows in a manner that creates a competitive advantage for the Regions and Business Units.

What You’ll Do

In collaboration with the Regions, Business Units, and other Functional groups:Manage relationships with key Carriers, Transportation/Logistics Service Providers and Powered Industrial Equipment Vendors to align service/product offerings with the strategic operational needs of the Regions and Business Units while also negotiating competitive rates and rebates. Review contracts to identify, investigate, and resolve transportation cost leakageDevelop and deploy national level policy, process, and procedures that optimize transportation and logistics services in a manner that creates competitive advantagesCollaborate with Risk Management and other teams as necessary to develop and execute programs that promote comprehensive driver safety and educationManage and optimize the Company’s employee vehicle programs to ensure process compliance, workflow completion, and business reporting/analyticsComprehensive delivery fleet management including, but not limited to, vehicle sourcing, vehicle retirement, fleet service billings, fleet maintenance, accident loss evaluation and disposition, regulatory registrationsManage the identification, licensing, deployment, and training of transportation and logistics technologies that evaluate route optimization, driver performance and behavior, POD capture and transparency, and other capabilities as may be necessary to support safe and efficient transportation/logistics operationsPerform routine transportation/logistics reviews to identify cost savings, eliminate duplication, simplify processes, and improve customer service.Facilitate the identification and implementation of transportation/logistics synergies and/or business integration opportunities for newly acquired businessesFacilitate the migration of the Company’s transportation/logistics equipment to sustainable energy, low carbon emission equipment and collaborate with external business partners to drive similar efforts throughout the value chainProject manage significant transportation/logistics initiatives as may be required to achieve strategic imperativesOther duties as assigned


The information contained in this job description is intended to describe the essential job functions required of those assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job. Please note that management retains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, integrity, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Rexel USA.

What You’ll Need

High School or GED Bachelor's Degree preferred 5+ years of experienceTransportation and/or logistics support or managementContract management and negotiationCommercial Driver’s License (CDL) preferred 


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Ability to create, maintain, and nurture a network of contacts (internally and externally) who may be useful in information sharing in the pursuit of achieving work-related goalsAbility to develop practical business solutions to simple and complex business issues while preserving relationships through the delivery of mutually acceptable outcomesAbility to effectively facilitate information exchange that delivers tangible results, conduct effective business meetings, present to small and large groups, and deliver concise and precise information to Senior Management


Working Conditions and Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Working Environment

Exposed to unpleasant or disagreeable physical environment such as high noise level and/or exposure to heat and cold Frequently – 21% to 50%Exposed to bio hazardous conditions Occasionally – up to 20%Exposed to toxic or caustic chemicals which mandate attention to safety considerations NoneExposed to electrical hazards; risk of electrical shock NoneHandles or works with potentially dangerous equipment Occasionally – up to 20%Travels to offsite locations Frequently – 21% to 50%


Physical Demands

Sit: Must be able to remain in a stationary position Frequently – 21% to 50%Walk: Must be able to move about inside/outside office or work location Frequently – 21% to 50%Use hands to finger, handle or feel: Operates a computer and other office machinery Constantly – at least 51%Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl: Must be able to crouch down to stock shelfs, pick up boxes, or position one’s self to maintain computers in the lab/under desks/in server closet Frequently – 21% to 50%Climb or balance: Must be able to ascend/descend on a ladder, forklift, pallet jack, or other warehouse equipment Frequently – 21% to 50%Talk, hear, taste, smell: Must be able to use senses to; effectively communicate with co-workers and clients and detect hazardous conditions Constantly – at least 51%


Weight and Force

Up to 10 pounds Frequently – 21% to 50%Up to 25 pounds Frequently – 21% to 50%Up to 50 pounds Occasionally – up to 20%Up to 75 pounds None


“Rexel USA (A VEVRAA Federal Contractor), and its affiliated companies, is an EEO/Disabled/Veterans employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristics protected by law.”

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
